thread.title: Disney offers Halloween on the High Seas on its four ships...
thread.title_full: Disney offers Halloween on the High Seas on its four ships... | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Sy O'Neill
title: Disney offers Halloween on the High Seas on its four ships...
text:
BOOS CRUISE: Halloween on the High Seas is back aboard Disney Cruise Line ships beginning next month.
The spook-tacular celebration takes place on most sailings through October, with seasonal activities, special decorations, themed parties and unique menu items.
Central to the festivities is The Pumpkin Tree, which magically transforms throughout the cruise.
More fun for cruisers young and old:
A Nightmare Before Christmas Sing and Scream, an interactive movie experience where guests are part of the action, followed by a meet-and-greet with Jack Skellington and Sally.
Creepy Cabaret, a party in the atrium featuring favorite Halloween-themed music performed live by a band of ghostly musicians.
Halloween Isn’t Just For Kids, an adult-only costume contest in the nighttime entertainment district, along with a Villainous Takeover on the dance floor.
Mickey’s Mouse-querade Party, a celebration with games, dancing and lots of candy. Disney characters in special Halloween costumes will join guests in the merriment.
Disney Magic sails four- and five-night Bahamas and Caribbean cruises departing from PortMiami Oct. 4-Oct. 28. Disney Dream offers three- and four-night Bahamas cruises from Port Canaveral from Sept. 7-Oct. 30. Disney Fantasy sails seven-night Eastern and Western Caribbean cruises from Port Canaveral departing Sept. 5-Oct. 31.
Visit www.disneycruise.com for more information.
‘I WANT YOU’: Princess Cruises is bringing The Voice of the Ocean to its ships beginning in October, with the show debuting on board Regal Princess.
The vocal competition — modeled after TV’s The Voice — begins with karaoke tryouts, with passengers and crew selecting contestants for the main event. During the week, those chosen to vie for The Voice of the Ocean trophy will rehearse with musicians and vocal mentors.
The final event will be hosted by the cruise director on the last night of the cruise. Three high-profile team coaches (maybe even the captain!) will listen to, but not see, the performers. And, as in the TV show, the coaches might turn their “I Want You” chairs to choose a singer for their teams.
Coaches will then pick a finalist from their teams, and members of the audience will use voting remotes to choose the winner.
The Voice of the Ocean comes to Royal Princess and Caribbean Princess in November. The competition rolls out on eight additional ships between January and May.
A DEAL FOR SINGLES: Windstar Cruises is offering solo travelers waived or reduced single supplement rates on more than 130 voyages booked by Sept. 18.
The single supplement is waived on 43 itineraries, including Caribbean Delights and Panama Passages; Dreams of Tahiti; Glitter and Glam of the Rivieras; and Morocco and the Canary Islands.
All fares include an ocean-view stateroom or suite, fine dining and a complimentary private event — an exclusive onshore cultural experience offered only on Windstar.
Learn more at www.windstarcruises.com .
MISSED THE BOAT: If you planned on getting on board this year’s Mad Decent Boat Party, you’re too late. The ship is sold out — but you can join the waiting list.
The four-day music festival is aboard Norwegian Pearl, setting sail from PortMiami Nov. 11 and calling on Cozumel. The lineup is lengthy and includes A-Trak, Alison Wonderland, Brunch Bounce, Flosstradamus, Keys N Krates, Skrillex and Snakehips.
More details are at www.maddecentboatparty.com .
